qeObjective: TEKS 8.18 The student selects and uses writing processes for self-initiated and assigned writing
qeSkill: D. Revise drafts for coherence, progression, and logical support of ideas
qeInstruction:
Writing is one way to communicate ideas.  Just as there are different ideas, there are different types of writing.  As you write you must consider your reason for writing.  What information do you have to express?  Who will read what you write, or rather, who is your AUDIENCE?  Your audience and your PURPOSE or reason for writing will help determine your LEVEL OF LANGUAGE or the kind of words you use. Will you use formal or informal language?

In this exercise you will determine what level of language to use for different situations.

To answer the questions, make a selection then click on
"Submit Your Answer."

To answer the questions, read the passage, choose the best way to write each numbered section or the group of emphasized words in the numbered section, then click on "Submit Your Answer."

If the section needs no changes, select "Correct as is."

qeObjective: LEVEL OF LANGUAGE
qeSkill: RECOGNIZE APPROPRIATE AUDIENCE FOR GIVEN TOPICS
qeInstruction:
Writing is one way to communicate ideas. Just as there are different ideas, there are different types of writing. As you write you must consider your reason for writing. What information do you have to express? Who will read what you write, or rather, who is your AUDIENCE? Your audience and your PURPOSE or reason for writing will help determine your LEVEL OF LANGUAGE or the kind of words you use. Will you use formal or informal language?

In this exercise you will determine what level of language to use for different situations.

To answer the questions, make a selection then click on "Submit Your Answer."

qeObjective: TEKS 5.2 The student uses recursive writing processes when appropriate.
qeSkill: a. Proofread writing for appropriateness of organization,content,style,and conventions.
qeInstruction:
You will be presented with a given topic. First, samples of some responses from other students to that topic are displayed. Using the Scoring description below, rate the given responses.

Next, write your own response to the topic and give it to your teacher for scoring.

SCORING

A score of 4 is given when the writing sample COMPLETELY fulfills the purpose in a pleasing manner.

A score of 3 is given when the writing sample ADEQUATELY fulfills the purpose without serious errors.

A score of 2 is given when the writing sample BARELY fulfills the purpose and errors may be numerous.

A score of 1 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT COMMUNICATE EFFECTIVELY due to either content or errors.

A score of 0 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT ADDRESS THE PURPOSE even though it may be error-free.

qeObjective: Passages
qeSkill: Booklet
qeInstruction:
Writing is one way to communicate ideas.  Just as there are different ideas, there are different types of writing.  As you write you must consider your reason for writing.  What information do you have to express?  Who will read what you write, or rather, who is your AUDIENCE?  Your audience and your PURPOSE or reason for writing will help determine your LEVEL OF LANGUAGE or the kind of words you use. In this exercise you will determine what level of language to use for different situations.

qeInstruction:
First you will be presented with a given topic. Samples of some responses from other students to that topic are then displayed. Using the Scoring description below, rate the given responses. Then write your own response to the topic.

SCORING

   A score of 4 is given when the writing sample COMPLETELY fulfills the purpose in a pleasing manner.

   A score of 3 is given when the writing sample ADEQUATELY fulfills the purpose without serious errors.

   A score of 2 is given when the writing sample BARELY fulfills the purpose and errors may be numerous.

   A score of 1 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT COMMUNICATE EFFECTIVELY due to either content or errors.

   A score of 0 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT ADDRESS THE PURPOSE even though it may be error-free.

qeObjective: WRITING SAMPLE
qeSkill: A. DEVELOP, EXPRESS, PROBLEM SOLVE; B. PERSUADE AND ARGUE; C. INFORM, EXPLAIN, NARRATE, ENTERTAIN; E. IDENTIFIABLE VOICE; G. LITERARY DEVICES; H. ORGANIZE; B, C, D, E, F. CAP., PUNCT., AND SPELLING; A
qeInstruction:
You will be presented with a given topic. First, samples of some responses from other students to that topic are displayed. Using the Scoring description below, rate the given responses.

Next, write your own response to the topic and give it to your teacher for scoring.

SCORING

A score of 4 is given when the writing sample COMPLETELY fulfills the purpose in a pleasing manner.

A score of 3 is given when the writing sample ADEQUATELY fulfills the purpose without serious errors.

A score of 2 is given when the writing sample BARELY fulfills the purpose and errors may be numerous.

A score of 1 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT COMMUNICATE EFFECTIVELY due to either content or errors.

A score of 0 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT ADDRESS THE PURPOSE even though it may be error-free.

qeObjective: Peer Editing
qeSkill: Recognize correct organization, sentence boundaries, verb tense, word choice, punctuation, and spelling errors.
qeInstruction:
In this exercise you will determine the best way to write a selected group of words. The selected group of words may be made up of the entire numbered section or emphasized words (bold italics) within the numbered section referred to by the question.

Included in the sections may be one of the following: incomplete sentences, fragments, correctly written sentences that should be combined, or correctly written sentences that do not need to be rewritten.

To answer the questions, read the passage, choose the best way to write each numbered section or the group of emphasized words in the numbered section, then click on "Submit Your Answer."

If the section needs no changes, select "Correct as is."

qeObjective: 7.18 Select and use writing processes for self-initiated and assigned writing
qeSkill: H. Proofread his/her own writing and that of others
qeInstruction:
You will be presented with a given topic. First, samples of some responses from other students to that topic are displayed. Using the Scoring description below, rate the given responses.

Next, write your own response to the topic and give it to your teacher for scoring.

SCORING

A score of 4 is given when the writing sample COMPLETELY fulfills the purpose in a pleasing manner.

A score of 3 is given when the writing sample ADEQUATELY fulfills the purpose without serious errors.

A score of 2 is given when the writing sample BARELY fulfills the purpose and errors may be numerous.

A score of 1 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT COMMUNICATE EFFECTIVELY due to either content or errors.

A score of 0 is given when the writing sample DOES NOT ADDRESS THE PURPOSE even though it may be error-free.

qeObjective: TEKS 8.15 Write for a variety of audiences and purposes and in a variety of forms.
qeSkill: E. Select and use voice and style appropriate to audience and purpose.
qeInstruction:
Writing is one way to communicate ideas.  Just as there are different ideas, there are different types of writing.  As you write you must consider your reason for writing.  What information do you have to express?  Who will read what you write, or rather, who is your AUDIENCE?  Your audience and your PURPOSE or reason for writing will help determine your LEVEL OF LANGUAGE or the kind of words you use. Will you use formal or informal language?

In this exercise you will determine what level of language to use for different situations.

To answer the questions, make a selection then click on
"Submit Your Answer."

REMINDER: WORK CAREFULLY!

qeObjective: Writing Passages and links
qeSkill: Writing Passages in rtf format
qeInstruction:
In this exercise you will determine the best way to write a selected group of words. The selected group of words may be made up of the entire numbered section or emphasized words (bold italics) within the numbered section referred to by the question.

Included in the sections may be one of the following: incomplete sentences, fragments, correctly written sentences that should be combined, or correctly written sentences that do not need to be rewritten.

To answer the questions, read the passage, choose the best way to write each numbered section or the group of emphasized words in the numbered section, then click on "Submit Your Answer."

If the section needs no changes, select "Correct as is."

REMINDER: WORK CAREFULLY!
